Description: September-December window in which spawning occurs (by the parents of the designated cohort).
January-December window during which a cohort hatches and rears in freshwater.
January-July window during which a cohort grows in freshwater and outmigrates to the ocean.

The day, usually in the fall, on which the Scott River gains a certain degree of connectivity. Defined as the first day on which FJ Gauge flow rises above a designated threshold (e.g., 10 or 100 cfs) (units of days after Aug. 31).

The day, usually in the spring or early summer, on which the Scott River loses a certain degree of connectivity. Defined as the first day on which FJ Gauge flow drops below a designated threshold (e.g., 10 or 100 cfs) (units of days after Aug. 31).
Minimum average daily flowrate recorded in the relevant period.
The (conservatively wide) 21-month window, September through July, in which members of a cohort or the cohort's spawning parents are present in the freshwater system.
Sum of all daily flow volumes recorded in the relevant period.
Peak magnitude of fall pulse event (maximum daily peak flow during event) (cfs)
Start date of wet-season in water year days
Wet-season baseflow duration (# of days from start of wet-season to start of spring season)
Spring flow recession rate (median daily rate of change over decreasing periods during the recession)
50th percentile of daily flow within dry season
90th percentile of daily flow within dry season
